title: Persian Style Chicken
ingredients: One whole chicken, cleaned, approximately 4 pounds
instructions: Cook the rice in 1 quart of lightly salted, boiling water for 7 to 8 minutes, then drain it thoroughly and set aside.

Melt ¼-cup of the butter and in it sauté the onion until it is golden.  When the onion is golden stir in the raisins, walnuts, turmeric, and cumin and stir to mix the ingredients well.  Remove from the heat and add the drained rice.  Mix the ingredients well and season with salt and pepper to your individual taste.  Set the mixture aside to cool enough for you to handle it.
Wipe the chicken, inside and out, and pour half the lemon juice inside the cavity.

Stuff the chicken with the rice mixture and truss, then place the chicken on a roasting pan.  Pour the remaining lemon juice over the chicken and sprinkle it with salt.  Spread the remaining butter over the chicken, with the majority covering the breast.
remarks: The stuffing for this chicken is fragrant and spicy.  To serve garnish with lemon slices and fresh cilantro leaves.
source: Harrods Cookery Book by Marilyn Aslani, Arbor House, New York, © 1985 by Marilyn Aslani and the National Magazine Co. Ltd.
